title: Quiz: FQE June 2022 Past Paper
description: Final Qualifying Examination from June 2022 covering clinic preparation, filing systems, and electronic health records.

questions.question: Which of the following activities is not conducted during Clinic preparation?
questions.explanation: Clinic preparation involves Sorting (lists), Tracing (finding files), and Retrieval (pulling files). Editing (assembling/checking order) typically occurs after discharge.
questions.hint: Which activity happens *after* the patient has been seen, not before?

questions.question: What is the main function of a waiting list?

options.text: Be able to make full use of the available beds
Individual patients can know when they are supposed to be admitted in wards
Consultants can easily know how many patients are in their waiting list

questions.explanation: The primary administrative function is to optimize bed occupancy (fill empty beds immediately).

questions.question: Who was the first leader in the movement to establish the first incorporated hospital within the United States?
questions.explanation: Benjamin Franklin co-founded Pennsylvania Hospital (1751).

questions.question: Which of the following information is not contained in a unit number Register?
questions.explanation: The Register contains demographic/ID data. Diagnosis is clinical data found in the file.

questions.question: Patients have no right to their notes even when they have paid. What is the general word for this statement?
questions.explanation: Physical ownership of the record belongs to the hospital.

questions.question: ____ is the act of testing a form whether it has been approximately designed for the work it is going to be used for.
questions.explanation: Pre-testing (piloting) checks if a form works before mass printing.

questions.question: ____ is the objective method of applying a yardstick to the quality of professional performance.
questions.explanation: Medical Audit is the systematic analysis of the quality of medical care.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a paper based method of destruction?
questions.explanation: Degaussing destroys magnetic media (hard drives/tapes), not paper.

questions.question: The determination of the value of records before they are disposed is referred to as:
questions.explanation: Appraisal is determining the value (administrative, legal, historical) of records.

questions.question: Which of the following records are not supposed to be stored permanently?
questions.explanation: Registers are permanent. OPC cards are eventually destroyed (retention period applies).
questions.hint: Which is a daily card vs a statutory book?

questions.question: ____ is the document used to acquire goods from the store.
questions.explanation: S 11 is the Counter Requisition and Issue Voucher.

questions.question: ____ is a consent which arises when a patient signs a document authorizing the hospital to disclose his history.
questions.explanation: Written signature = Express consent.

questions.question: Which of the following is the most economical type of filing equipment as far as space is concerned?
questions.explanation: Mobile racking (Compactus) saves the most floor space.

questions.question: Which of the following documents should ideally be filed at the patient folder?
questions.explanation: The Face Sheet (Front sheet) goes at the front for identification.

questions.question: Which one of the following equipment is not suitable for recording appointment?
questions.explanation: Carousel is for filing, not for writing down appointments.
questions.hint: Which is storage, not a book?

questions.question: Which of the following is not included in a daily bed return?
questions.explanation: DBR is for Inpatients. OPC is Outpatient.
questions.hint: Which one is not a ward activity?

questions.question: Which tracer card is created the same time as the case folder and is filed inside the folder?
questions.explanation: Personal tracer is unique to the file and stays inside it until needed.
questions.hint: It belongs to that person's file.

questions.question: Confidentiality related to medical records can be regarded in three points of view below except:
questions.explanation: Legal, Ethical, and Administrative/Professional are the standard aspects. 'Common sense' is informal.

questions.question: ____ refers to protection of information system of medical records against unauthorized disclosure.
questions.explanation: Security refers to the mechanisms protecting the data.

questions.question: Who in the hospital is supposed to fill the death notification?
questions.explanation: Only a doctor (Medical Officer) can certify death.

questions.question: A court's order to the physician to produce the records in court is referred to as:
questions.explanation: Subpoena duces tecum.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of method of filing patient master index?
questions.explanation: PMI is alphabetical. Phonetic (Soundex) handles spelling variations.

questions.question: ____ is a health record system in which all records notes relating to one patient are contained in one case folder
questions.explanation: Unit system = One patient, One folder.

questions.question: Taking down the identification details of a patient through telephone and through writing a letter before the patient attends the hospitals is referred to as:
questions.explanation: Registering *before* arrival.

questions.question: What is the process through which information is reproduced mechanically once a master document containing this information has been created?
questions.explanation: Reproduction (Reprography).

questions.question: Who is credited with the authorship of Edwin Smith Papyrus?
questions.explanation: Imhotep is associated with the early Egyptian medical texts.

questions.question: The records that are initiated for patients who get admitted into the wards are referred to as:
questions.explanation: Inpatients have 'Case Records'.

questions.question: ____ is the ability of an individual to use his/her own knowledge to make decisions.
questions.explanation: Discretion is using judgment.

questions.question: Which of the following is not an example of Special Health Records?
questions.explanation: Surgical records are part of the general file. Psych, TB, and Maternity have special legal status.
questions.hint: Which one is just a standard part of a general hospital stay?

questions.question: Which one of the following is not an equipment used to maintain Master Index Cards?
questions.explanation: Suspended filing is for large A4 files, not small cards.
questions.hint: Which is for big paper files?

questions.question: What is the appointment system where the master index will be near the area for quick reference?
questions.explanation: Centralized systems locate MPI and booking together.

questions.question: ____ is an index of all patients waiting admission to hospital or waiting treatment on a day case basis.
questions.explanation: Definition of Waiting List.

questions.question: ____ is the type of filing equipment which consists of a series of shelves or suspended files rotating round a fixed spindle.
questions.explanation: Rotating shelves = Carousel.

questions.question: Which one of the following is not an example of ancillary equipment?
questions.explanation: Pigeon holes are sorting equipment. Others are ancillary support tools.

questions.question: The admission of psychiatric patients without legal or other formalities is referred to as:
questions.explanation: Informal = Voluntary.

questions.question: What is customer satisfaction process?
questions.explanation: QA ensures services meet customer needs.

questions.question: Which of the following checks is NOT made on the waiting list?

options.text: Checking for the diagnosis of a patient

questions.explanation: Clerks check accuracy/completeness. Diagnosis check is clinical.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a reason for ensuring a medical record contains sufficient data?

options.text: Support the disclosure of the patient details
Justify the treatment, support the diagnosis

questions.explanation: Disclosure is a function, not a reason for *sufficiency* of clinical data.
questions.hint: Which is about giving info away?

questions.question: In which year did training of Health Record Officers start in Kenya?
questions.explanation: Certificate training started in 1978.

questions.question: ____ is the section of medical records department that arranges admission for emergency patients
questions.explanation: Bed Bureau arranges admissions.

questions.question: State five (5) importance of Quality Assurance
questions.explanation:
Importance:

  1. Improved Patient Care
  2. Error Reduction
  3. Cost Effectiveness
  4. Compliance with standards
  5. Staff Motivation
  6. Patient Satisfaction

questions.question: Five (5) basic principles of form design
questions.explanation:
Principles:

  1. Simplicity
  2. Standardization
  3. Identification (Title/Number)
  4. Sequence (Logical flow)
  5. Spacing
questions.hint: What makes a form easy to fill?

questions.question: What are the five importance of scheduling patients' appointment
questions.explanation:
Importance:

  1. Reduces Waiting Time
  2. Resource Optimization
  3. Continuity of Care (Preparation)
  4. Workload Management
  5. Patient Convenience

questions.question: Explain 5 qualities of an appraiser
questions.explanation:
Qualities:

  1. Knowledgeable
  2. Objective
  3. Thorough
  4. Experienced
  5. Foresight

questions.question: State 5 Acts of medical records
questions.explanation:
Acts:

  • Public Health Act
  • Mental Health Act
  • Evidence Act
  • Registration of Births/Deaths Act
  • Medical Practitioners Act

questions.question: Briefly explain 5 instances where health records can be used as evidence
questions.explanation:
Instances:

  1. Malpractice Suits
  2. Criminal Cases
  3. Insurance Claims
  4. Worker's Compensation
  5. Will Contests (Capacity)

questions.question: State 5 functions of a bed bureau
questions.explanation:
Functions:

  1. Monitor Bed Occupancy
  2. Coordinate Admissions
  3. Liaison with wards
  4. Waitlist Management
  5. Reporting stats

questions.question: Explain 8 core-care delivery functions that electronic HR system should be capable of (Long Answer)
questions.explanation:
8 Core Functions (IOM):

  1. Health Information and Data
  2. Result Management
  3. Order Entry/Management
  4. Decision Support
  5. Electronic Communication
  6. Patient Support
  7. Administrative Processes
  8. Reporting/Population Health
